title.narrative: Girls Education - Phase 3 Capacity building on Civic Education and Teachers Training for enhancement of Quality of Girls Education in Afghanistan

description.narrative:
1) Conduct 30 awareness sessions on the importance of education for children/girls for 350 parents/community members
2) Conduct 8 training sessions on child rights for 120 Shura/CDCs’ members, community elders and religious bodies
3) Run eight 3-day summer camps for 400 girl students and 80 teachers
4) Capacity building of 2-3 local Afghan staff as teachers trainers.
5) Organize two 5-day master teacher training courses on child psychology, child rights, gender equality, peace education and teaching methodologies with 40 target teachers
6) Organize eight 5-day teacher training courses on child psychology, child rights, gender equality, peace education and teaching methodologies with 160 target teachers. This will be done by local trainers.
7) Follow ups conducted by 40 master trainers and local trainers
8) Competition for trained teachers on developing the most innovative and creative teaching aids using local resources (as taught in the workshops).
9) Celebrating international days such as Earth Day
10) Establish and support 8 SSCs and PTCs in target schools
12) Conduct and facilitate monthly SSC and PTC meetings in 8 target school
13) Provide low cost indigenous materials, such as abacus and magnetic boards for 500 newly enrolled girls within 8 target schools. Also provide school bags for 500 newly enrolled girls within 8 target schools.
Girl Students, Teachers, Community Members/parents, Shura/CDCs members, community elders and religious bodies

The Project will aim to provide complimentary learning opportunities for the girls as a way of extending the state curriculum where such opportunities are not given. It will also train teachers, and trainers of teachers, in the target schools, enabling them to deliver quality education which has a meaningful and long term impact on students lives. The project also aims to address the societal barriers by focusing on awareness raising strategies with community elders, parents and religious elders.
